keywords.term: Clifford, Peter A. Long (Clifford, Williams), Grace E. Clifford, Alice B. Burt. J. J. White, W. H. DeLang, James Hanford, C. H. Ayres, A. Reeves Matthew, H. M. Herice, Deevnay Fuller, Melville W. Hopkins, C. B. Stringer, John Heade, Matthew H. Tallman, Boyd J. Humphreys, William P.

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
PETER A. CLIFFORD, PETITIONER, vs. HERBERT O. WILLIAMS and GRACE E. WILLIAMS, Respondents.
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Division:-
The petition of Peter A. Clifford respectfully shows:
I.

That at all the times herein stated he was and now is a citizen and resident of the State of California, and that respon- dents are and for more than eight months last past have been citizens and residents of the State of Washington, in the County of King.
II.

That on the 17th day of October, A. D. 1899, one Grace E. Long was a citizen and resident of the State of California, and on that day your petitioner and the said Grace E. Long, at the City and County of San Francisco, in the said State of Califor- nia, intermarried, and bacame husband and wife, and the said Grace E. Long thereby became Grace E. Clifford.
III.

That thereafter your petitioner and his said wife lived together in the City and County of San Francisco, State of Cal- ifornia until about the 7th day of March, A. D. 1901, and that on or about the said last named day the said Grace E. Clif- ford deserted and abandoned your petitioner without any just cause and without his consent.
IV.

That during the marriage of your petitioner and the said Grace E. Clifford, there was born to them, as the issue of said marriage, a female child, now living, and of the age of four years, named Alice B. Clifford.
V.

That on the 24th day of March, A. D. 1902, the said Grace E. Cliffored commenced an action in the Superior Court in and for the City and County of San Francisco, State of California, for an absolute divorce from your petitioner, and therein prayed for the custody of said child of said mariage, and your petit- ioner appeared in said action and filed his answer, and also a cross-complaint for a divorce from said Grace E. Clifford there- in, and in said cross-complaint prayed that the custody of said child should be awarded to him by said Court.
VI.

That thereafter such proceedings were had in such action and cross-action that the judgment of said court was given, made and entered therein, denying a divorce to said Grace E. Clifford and granting a divorce to your petitioner, and awarding the custody of said child to said Grace E. Clifford until the further order of the court; and providing that your petitioner should be al- lowed to see said child once a week and to take the same out with him once in every two weeks.
VII.

That at the time of the commencement of said action and from thenoe on down and including the time of the entry of said judg- ment, your petitioner, thhe said Grace E. Clifford, and said child were all citizens and bona fide residents of the said City and County of San Francisco, in said State of California, and actually present therein, and your petitioner and the said Grace E. Clifford had been such citizens and residents of said City and County continuously since the date of their said marriage, and said child had been such citizen and resident continuously since the date of her birth, and within the jurisdiction of said Superior Court in said acion and cross-section, and said Superior Court was then and yet is a court of record and of superior jur- isdiction.
VIII.

That after the date of entry of said judgment by said Superior Court, the said Grace E. Clifford continued to reside in said City and County of San Francisco until some time in September, A. D. 1903, the exact time being unknown to your petitioner, and that during said moth she secretly and surrepti- tiously and without the permission of said Superior Court, and in contempt thereof, and without the knowledge or consent of your petitioner, took said child out of the State of Califor- nia.
IX.

That on the 27th day of November, A. D. 1903, your petition- er fled in said Superior Court a verified petition in said ac- tion and cross-action for a modification of the judgment there- in by taking away from the custody of the said Grace E. Clifford the said child and awarding the custody thereof to your petit- ioner, and such proceedings were thereupon had that an order was made and entered therein modifying and changing said judgment and taking the custody of said child from said Grace E. Clifford and awarding the same to your petitioner until the further order of the said Superior Court, and said order ever since has been and still is standing and not set aside, and in full force and effect, and under the laws of the State of California, at the time of the commencement of said action, and at the time of the entry of said judgment, and at the time of the making of the said order, said child was a ward of said Court and under the control thereof; and it is provided by the laws of the said State that said Court could at any tme after the entry of said judgment make any order with or without notice modifyig said judgmet as to the custody of said child.
X.

That since the said judgment of divorce, the said Grace E. Clifford and one Herbert O. Williams above named, intermarried in said State of California, and became and ever since have been and now are husband and wife and evrer since their said marriage have had in the State of California and elsewhere and now at the town of Georgetown, in said County of King, saod child in their custody and posession.
XI.

That on the 19th day of January, 1904, at the said town of Georgetown, your petitioner presented to the said Herbet O. Williams and also to the said Grace E. Williams, a copy of the record and proceedings of the said Superior Court of said City and County of San Francisco, in said acion and cross-section, certified under and in pursuance of an Act of the Congress of the United Sates in such case made and provided, and demanded from them and eachof them the immediate delivery of the said child to him, said petitioner, but they refused and still do refuse to give up said child, and said child ever since has been and now is imprisoned and restrained of her liberty by them at said town of Georgettown, and that according to the best of your petitioner's knowledge and belief, the cause of pretense of the aforesaid confinement or restraint of the said child, Alice B. Clifford, is that under the said judgment of said Superior Court of said City and County of San Francisco, the custody of said child was given to said Grace E. Clifford, now Grace E. Williams, umtil further order of the Court, and that after she took said child beyond the limits of said State of California, as afore- saod, said Superior Court lost all jurisdiction to make any fur- ther order in said action and cross-section in regard to any mod- ification of said judgment as to the custody of said child, and that she had the right to take said child beyond the jurisdic- tion of the State of California without first obtaining therefor the permission of said Court, and that after said child was taken into said State of Washington said Herbet O. Williams and without the knowledge or consent of said Superior Court of said City and County of San Francisco, and without giving any notice thereof, undertook, under the laws of the said State of Washington, to adpot said child as husband and wife, as theor own. And your petitioner further states that he believes and therefore alleges, ad he is advised by counsel W. H. White, Esq., residing at the City of Seattle, State of Washington, and J. J. Burt, Esq., residing at the City and County of San Francisco, State of California, that the said imprisonment of the said child, Alice B, Clifford, is illegal, and that the illegality consists in this, to-wit:-

That said Superior Court of the said City and County of San Francisco had jurisdiction under the laws of the State of Calif- ornia, to award the custody of said child upon the fact here- onbefore alleged until the further order of that Court, and to thereinafter change and modify the judgment as to the custody of said child with or without notice to any or either of the parties to said action, and that the said Grace E. Williams and Herbert O. Williams had no, nor had either of them any, right or power under the laws of California, to remove said child from the State of California or change its placee of residence there- from to any other place without the permission of said Superior Court of said City and County of San Francisco, and that under Art. IV, Sec 1 of the Constitution of the United States, and Section 905 Revised statutes if the United States enacted i pursuance thereof, full faith and credit must be given in the State of Washington to the acts and proceedings of said Super- ior Court of the City and County of San Francisco, and all per- sons and courts must recognize the petitioner's right to the custody of said child under said order in said State of Washing- ton; as wel as under the laws of commity existing between said State of Washington and said State of California; and that also under the laws of Washington said attempted adpotion was illegal and void, for the reason thar there is no provision in the laws of Washington authorizing any person to adopt hi or her own legitimate child by birth, and that under the laws of the State of Washington there is no provision allowing or permit- ing a woman who has married again to consent to or permir the adoption of any child which she may have had by her first husband and from whom she has been divorced, and that the con sent given by Grace E. Williams for the adoption of said child and said adoption proceedings was given to its adoption by herself and the said Herbert O. Williams, and not to the said Herbert O. Williams, with whom she was at the time living as her husband, alone.
XIII.

And your petitioner further states that there is danger that the said Herbet O. Willliams and the said Grace E. Wil- liams will take or send the said child out of the jurisdiction of this court, from the fact that they secret;y, and without the permission of the saodd Court in the City and County of
Peter A. Clifford Petitioner.
W H White J. J. Burt, Co Counsil.

ting a woman when she has married again to consent to or permit the adoption of any child which she have had by her first husband and from whom she has been divorced, and that the con sent given by said Grace E. Williams for the adoption of said child and said adoption proceedings was given to its adoption by herself and the said Herbet O. Williams, and not to the said Herbert O. Williams, with whom she was at the time living as her husband, alone.
XII.

And your petitioner further states that there is danger that the said Herbet O. Williams and the said Grace E. Wil- liams will take or send the said child out of the jurisdiction of this court, from the fact that they secretly, and without the permission of the said Court in the City and County of San Fracisco, and in contempt thereof, took said child be- yond the limits of the State of California.

WHEREFORE, your Petitioner set up and claims, upon the fore- going facts set out in this petition, under the said Article IV., Section I, of the Constiution of the United States and Section 905 of the Revised Statutes of the United States, the right to the immediate custody of said child Alice B. Clifford to be taken back, and restored, to the jurisdiction of the Superior Court of City and County of San Francisco, State of California, and prays a writ of habeas corps directed to the said Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams commanding them to bring up the body of the said child, Alice B. Clifford, to abide such order as your Honor may make, and that also a warrant issue to the marshal of the Untied States for this District commanding him to take said child into his cusotdy and to hold the same in his custody until the final determination of this petition.
Peter A. Clifford Petitioner.
W H White Attorney for Peitioner J. J. Burt Of Counsil.
Peter A, Clifford, being first duly sworn, on his oath deposes and says:
I am the petitioner in the above entitled cause; I have read the foregoing petition, know the contents thereof, and verily believe the same to be true.
Peter A. Clifford
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 3rd day of June, A. D. 1904 James DeLang Commissioner for Washington in San Francisco, California.

Upon reading and filing the foregoing petition, verified by the petitioner, whereby it appears that Alice B. Clifford is illegally imprisionmented restrained of her liberty by Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams at the town of Georgetown, County of King, State of Washington, and stating wherein the il- legality consists, from which it appears to me that a writ of habeas corpus should issue;

IT IS ORDERED: That a writ of habeas corpus issue out of and under the seal of the above named Circuit Court, directed to the said Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, commanding them and each of them to have the body of Alice B. Clifford be- fore me on the 9th day of June A. D. 1904, at the hour of ten o'clock A. M., at the Court room of the said Court in the City of Seattle, State of Washington, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Alice B. Cliffordm together with the time and cause of her de- tention, and that they have then and there the said writ.

It further appearing that there is good reason to believe that said Alice B. Clifford will be carried out of and beyond the jurisdiction of said Court, it is ordered that a warrant issue out of and under the seal of said court to the marshal of said District commanding him to take the said Alice B. Clifford and to hold her in custody until the determination of said pe- tition.
Dated, June 7th 1904.
C. H. Hanford Judge.
No. 1204 Tx IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASH- INGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
PETER A. CLIFFORD, Petitioner,
vs. HERBERT O. WILLIAMS and GRACE E. WILLIAMS, Respondents.
PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS. Order

Peter A. Clifford Pet vs. Herert O. Williams Ref Appearance Filed FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. 190 JUN 9 1904 Clerk A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk HM Matthew Deputy Deputy Clerk Sweeney Attys For Ref
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES , NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A, Clifford, Petitioner vs. Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, Respondents. WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
The President of the United States of America to Herbet O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, G r e e t i n g :

We command you that you have the body of Alice B. Clifford, now held by you in illegal custody and detention, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such detention, by whatso- ever name the said Alice B. Clifford shall be called before the above named Court, at the court room of said court in the City of Seattle, County of King, State of Washington, on the 9th day of June 1904, at 10 o'clock A. M. of said day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered and determined concerning the said Alice B. Clifford, and that you have then and there this writ.
WITNESS the HONORABLE Melville W. Fuller, Chief Justice of the United States, this 7th day of June, A. D. 1904. A. Revees Ayres Clerk. By HM Matthew Deputy Clerk.
Form No. 282. RETURN ON SERVICE OF WRIT. United States of America, ) DISTRICT OF WASH) ss.

I hereby certify that I served the annexed Writ of Habeas Corpus on the therein-named Grace E. Williams by handing to and leaving a true and correct copy thereof with Grace E. Williams personally at Georgetown in said District on the 8 day of June , A. D. 190
Marshals for service 6.00 1.50 7.50 Service Expenses
C. B, HOPKINS, U. S. Marshal.
By John Stringer Deputy.
DISTRICT OF Wash ) ss:

I hereby certify that I served the annexed writ. of. Habeas Corpus on the therein-named Herbert O. Williams By delivering to and leaving with his wife Grace E. Williams at his usual place of abode She being a resident therein and a person of suitable age and decision at Georgetown in said District on the 8 day of June, A. D. 190X C. B, HOPKINS, U. S. Marshal. By John Stringer Deputy.
No., 1204 Tx
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASH- INGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
PETER A. CLIFFORD, Petitioner
vs.
HERBERT O. WILLIAMS, GRACE E. WILLIAMS Respondents.
WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JUN 9 1904 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk HM Matthew Deputy.
W. H White ATTORNEY- AT- LAW SAVINGS UNION BUILDING 530 California Street, SAN FRANSISCO, CAL. J. J. Burt; Co Counsil.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs. Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, Respondents. W A R R A N T.
To C. B. HOPKINS, Marshal of the United States for the Dis- trict of Washington, Northern Division:
WHEREAS, Peter A. Clifford as applied to me for a warrant to take Alice B. Clifford, alleged to be in the custody of Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams; and

WHEREAS, it appears from the proof before me on such applica- tion that the said Alice B. Clifford is held in illegal custody by the said Herbert O. Williams and Grace E Williams, and that there is good reason to believe that she will be carried out of the jurisdiction of this Court before she can be relieved by a writ of habeas corpus, and this warrant having been ordered to issue by the Honorable the above named Court.

THESE ARE THEREFORE TO COMMAND YOU, in the name of the Pres- ident of the United States of America, that you forthwith take the said Alice B. Clifford and bring her before the Honorable above named Court, at the Court room there- of, in the City of Seattle, State of Washington, on the 9th day of June 1904, at Ten o'clock A M. of said day to be dealt with according to law.
WITNESS Melville W. Fuller, Chief Justice of the United States, the 7th day of June 1904.
A. Reeves Ayres Clerk. By, HM Matthew Deputy Clerk.
W H White Attorney for Petitioner. J. J. Burt, Co Counsil.
United States of America, ) DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. ) ss.

I, C. B. Hopkin U. S. Marshal for the District of Washington, do hereby certify that I received the within Warrant on the 7 day of June 1904 and in pursuance thereof have the said Alice B. Clifford, before this Honorable Court as eviction I am commanded this 9 day of June 1904
CB Hopkins U. S. Marshal, By John Stringer Deputy.
No. 1204. Tx
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTH- ERN DIVISION.
PETER A. CLIFFORD, Petitioner, vs. HERBERT O. WILLIAMS and GRACE E. WILLIAMS, Respondents. W A R R A N T.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JUN 9 1904 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk. HM Matthew Deputy
W. H. White ATTORNEY-AT-LAW SAVINGS UNION BUILDING 530 California Street, SAN FRANCISCO, CAL. J. J. Burt, Co Counsil.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES NINTH JUDICIAL DISTRICT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams. Respondents.
No. 1804. APPLICATION FOR CONTINUANCE.

Comes now the respondents, Herbet O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, by Sweeneyy and Steiner, their attorneys and moved the Court for a continuance herein from the 9th day of June, 1904, at the hour of ten o'clock, for the period of ten days or until such time as this Honorable Court may deem just and proper.
This motion is based upon the affidavits of G. E. Steiner and respondents, Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams.
Sweeney
No. 1204. Tx
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES. DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner vs. Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams. Respondents. Motion for continuance.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JUN 9 1904 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk. HM Matthew Deputy
Sweeney and Steiner, Attorneys for Respondents. Haller Buiding, Seattle, Wn.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES NINTH JUDICIAL DISTRICT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs Herbert O. Williams, and Grace E. Williams. Respondents. No. 1204. A F F I D A V I T.
United States of America ) District of Washington, ) SS. Northern Division. )
Herbert O. Williams, being first duly sworn on oath, de- poses and says:
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES NINTH JUDICIAL DISTRICT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs Herbert O. Williams, and Grace E. Williams, Respondents. United States of America District of Washington, )SS. Northern Division.
No. 1204. A F F I D A V I T .
Herbert O. Williams, being first duly sworn on oath, de- poses and says:

That the petition herein was served upon respondents by leaving a copy thereof at the residence of respondents with saiid Grace E. Williams, in Georgetown, Washington, on the 8th day of June, 1904, at about the hour of ;

The deponent is a carpenter by occupation and was working at his trade in Seattle, Washington on the 8th. day of June, 1904, and knew nothing of the service of said papers until informed by his counsel, Sweeney and Steiner, on the evening of the 8th. day of June, 1904, at about the house of P. M. ; that he had previously had no intimation or notice of the commencements of this action; that he has submitted the facts of the case to his counsel and is advised and believes that he has a complete defense to said writ; that said writ is maade returnable on the 8th, day of June, 1904, at the hour of ten o'clock A.M., and that it has been imposaible in the time between the service of said writ and the return thereof prepare respondent's defense; that he has used due dilligence in an effort to prepare his return to said writ on the day and hour designated by this Honorable Court; and he has found it impossible in so short a space of time to prepare a proper return to said writ; that if the petition herein is heard on its merits on the 9th. day of June, 1904, at the hour of ten o'clock, depondent will be deprived of an opportunity to properly inform this Court of the facts in this cause.
Herbert O. Williams Subscribed and sworn to before me this 9 day of June, 1904.
G. E. Steiner Notary Public in and for the State of Washingtion, residing at Seattle.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES NINTH JUDICIAL DISTRICT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs Herbert O. Williams, and Grace E. Williams, Respondents. United States of America District of Washington, )SS. Northern Division.
No. 1204. A F F I D A V I T .
Grace E. Williams, being first duly sworn on oath, deponses and says:
That she is a resident in King County, Washington, the wife of the respondent, Herbert O. Williams, and one of the respondents herein.

That respondent, Herbert O. Williams, her husband, is a carpenter by trade and was, at the time of service of said papers was made, at work on a building in Seattle; that deponent had no communi- cation with said Herbert O. Williams by telephone or otherwise and it was impossible to inform him of the service of said papers; that deponent requested the Marshall serving said papers, to inform re- spondents' counsel, Sweeney and Steiner of said service; that at about the hour of A.M., G.E. Steiner, one of our attorneys, called at deponent's residence in response to the notice given by said marshall and secured papers; that deponent has been diligent in the preparation of her defense to this writ and that she is advised by her counsel and believes that it will be impossible to prepare an adequate return to said writ within the time limited by this Honorable Court. Grace E. Williams
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 9 day of June, 1904.
G. E. Steiner Notary Public in and for the State of Washingtion, residing at Seattle.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES NINTH JUDICIAL DISTRICT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs Herbert O. Williams, and Grace E. Williams, Respondents. United States of America District of Washington, )SS. Northern Division.
No. 1204. A F F I D A V I T .
G.E. Steiner, being first duly sworn on oath, deposes and says:
That he is one of the attorneys for respondents herein and is conversant with the facts in this cause.

That the petition and writ issued herein were served upon respondents at the family residence at Georgetown, Washington, on the 9th. day of June, 1904, at about the hour of A.M. That deponent was informed of this fact by the Deputy United States Marshall who had made said service. Whereupon, deponent proceeded at once to the residence of said respondents to obtain said papers with a view to preparing a return thereon. That deponent then discovered that said writ was made returnable at ten o'clock on the day after the service thereof or at ten o'clock June 9, 1904.

That it is impossible to prepare an adequate return to said writ within the time allotted respondents' attorneys, and if this writ is heard o its merits on the day and hour designated for the return thereof, if will work a great hardship upon respondents and respondents' attorneys and deeat the ends of justice, in that said attorneys will not be prepared to adequately present the case to this Honorable Court.
G. E. Steiner Subscribed and sworn to before me this 9 day of June, 1904. Matthew H. Heade Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing in Seattle.

No. 1204. IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. NORTHERN DIVISION. Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs. Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, Respondents. FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JUN 9 1904 A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk HM Matthew Deputy
Sweeney and Steiner, Attorneys for Respondents. Haller Building, Seattle, Wash.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, Vs Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, Respondents. No. R e p l y .
Comes now the Petitioner herein and replying to the answer of the respondents herein, replies as follows:

Said Petitioner denies that by any reason of the writ of habeas corpus in Number 41787, or of any proceedings, or of any adjudica- tion of the Superior Court of the County of King, State of Washington, or of any Judges thereof, referred to in the answer of respondents, or by reason of any thingtherein, or any proceedings between the parties hereot, or any other persons or parties, he is estopped from further questioning any right or rights claimed by said respondents, or either of them, as to the custody of said child, Alice B. Clifford.
And in further reply said Petitioner avers and alleges:

That upon the hearing of said proceeding in said Superior Court and before the Honorable Boyd J. Tallman, the Judge before whom said hearing of said habeas corpus proceeding was had, said Petitioner presented and put in evidence a copy of the judicial records and proceedings of the Superior Court of the City and in the notion granting the divorce referred to in his petition herein County of San Francisco, State of California, authentioated a provided i Section 905 of the Revised Statutes of the United States, and claimed the right to the custody of said child upon the ground that is was being imprisoned and detained by respondents, and each of them, in violation of Article exemplified and IV, Section 1 of the United States and Section 905 of the Revised Statutes of the United States, and demanded that in pursuance of said provision of said Constitution and said provision of said Revised Statutes if the United States, full faith and credit to said records of said Superior Court of California should be given by said Court of Washington and the respondents herein, and that said child should be released from the imprisionment and detention by said respondents, and each of them, and delivered into the custody of your Petitioner, to be by him taken back to the juris- diction of said Court of California; but said Superior Court of Washington refused, and it appears upon the face of the records and proceedings of said Superior Court of Washington, in said habeas corpus proceedings therein, that said Court refused, to give any faith or credit to the records or proceedings of the said Court of California; and your Petitioner sets up and claims under said Article IV, Section 1, of the Constitution of the United States, and said Section 905 of the Revised Statutes of the United States, that said record and proceedings of said Superior Court of Wash- ington in the application therein for a writ of habeas corpus should be disregarded by this Court and held to be of no force or effect whatever.

Further replying to the answer of the respondents herein, as to the adoption of said child by proceedings in Number 5262 of said Superior Court of the State of Washington, said Petitioner avers and alleges that by reason of the facts set out in his petition herein, said child at the time said adoption proceedings were commended and had, and ever since, has been, a resident of and at all of said time had and yet has her domicile in the State of California, and that the facts of such residence and domicile and her being a ward of said Superior Court of California and subject to the control and jurisdiction thereof, were made to appear before the said Superior Court of Washington when said proceedings for the adoption of said child were taken and had therein, and said domicile and said wardship of said child appear upon the face of the records and proceedings of said Superior Court of said State of Washington in the matter of the adoption of said child, which consist of a petition by the respondents herein to be allowed to adopt said child, a copy of which is hereto attached marked "Exhibit A" and made a part hereof, a written consent to the adoption of said child, a copt of which is hereto attached, marked "Exhibit B" and made a part hereof, and an order for the adoption of said child, a copy of which is attached to the answer of the respondents herein marked "Exhibit E", and which is hereby referred to and made a part hereof, and of them alone; but nevertheless the said Court of Washington refused to give any faith or credit to the said records or proceedings of said Court of California, and made and entered said order allowing said adoption of said child; and your Petitioner hereby sets up and claims that under said Article IV, Section 1 of the Constitution of the United States and Section 905 of the Revised Statutes thereof, said order allowing said adoption is void, and of no force or effect.

And further replying as to the now pending in the Superior Court of the State of Washington in and for the County of King to set aside said order of adoption, said Petitioner alleges that said proceeding is nothing more than to have expunged from the records of that Court an order claimed by said Petitioner to be void and of no affect, and presents to reason why this appli- cation should be denied, abated or continued

And further replying to Exhibit C of respondents' answer, reffered to and adopted by them as a portion of their answer herein, said petitioner denies, as alleged in Parahraph IX thereof, that no notice whatever was served upon them, or either of them, or that they, or either of them, received no information as to the change of the decree of the Court of California as to this custody of said child; and on the contrary alleges that eight days' notice of the motion to modify the decree was given and served upon William P. Humphreys. Esq., who was and yet is the attorney of record for Grace E. Williams in the action wherein said decree was made and entered.

Futher replying to Paragraoh I of the affirmative defense of respondents' Exhibit C adopted as a portion of their answer herein, said Petitioner alleges and avers that all of thematters and things therein set up and alleged were set upp ad alleged in the complaints in actions brought by Grace E. Williams, as Grace E. Clifford, against your Petitioner in the said Court of California, wherein your Petitioner was granted a divore from her, and all of such matters and things were adjudged and decreed by said Court against her and in favor of your Petitioner, and are barred by the judgments therein, one which is the judgment granting said divorce; and further replying as to the matters and things set out in said paragraph, said Petitioner avers and alleges that they are beyond the jurisdiction of this Court upon this application, and are solely and exclusively within the jurisdiction of said Superior Court of California.

WHEREFORE, Petitioner objects to the consideration by this Court of any of the matters or things set out in this answer of the respondents herein, and respondents are notified hereby that upon the calling of this matter for hearing herein Petitioner will move the Court for judgment upon the pleadings herein, and for the granting of the prayer of his Petition herein; and in the case of the Court's refusal to grant said motion Petitioner will then offer evidence in support of his Petition herein, and of this Reply. W H White J. J. Burt Attorneys for Petitioner.
